Intervention.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the efficacy of acetaminophen and topical diclofenac (AtopD) combination therapy compared to monotherapies in osteoarthritis (OA) pain

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the efficacy of acetaminophen and topical diclofenac (AtopD) combination therapy compared to monotherapies in osteoarthritis (OA) pain

Result_Outcome.evidence: The MBMA revealed a statistically significant interaction coefficient, indicating a 32% reduction in opioid use with the combination versus acetaminophen monotherapy
